intro: Casearia paranaensis, commonly known as the Parana casearia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Salicaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Casearia paranaensis is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
